intro: Renvoizea acicularifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved renvoizea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves that give it its specific epithet "acicularifolia," meaning "needle-leaved." It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
